definition: lit. when you drink water, think of its source (idiom); gratitude for blessings and their well-spring/Don't forget where your happiness come from./Be grateful for all your blessings!
old variant of 飲|饮[yin3]
to give (animals) water to drink
to drink
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to think/to consider
root/source/origin

sentences.english: At the same time, we have to drink from the source, respecting teachers, Thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 同时，我们还要饮水思源，尊师感恩。

definition: see 吃水不忘掘井人[chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 jue2 jing3 ren2]
pinyin: chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 wa1 jing3 ren2

definition: to pay careful attention to one's parents' funerary rites
with great virtue one can take charge of the world (idiom)
doing good deeds brings the greatest joy (idiom)
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
to strive unremittingly/self-improvement
to be grateful
to bring honor to one's ancestors and benefit future generations (idiom)
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
to help those in distress (idiom)
to appreciate one's good fortune
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
school motto
